io.github.kushnirvladyslav.EventPublishers

Class TimeoutEventPublisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.kushnirvladyslav.EventPublisher
      • io.github.kushnirvladyslav.ExecuteEventPublisher
        • io.github.kushnirvladyslav.EventPublishers.TimeoutEventPublisher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class TimeoutEventPublisher
extends ExecuteEventPublisher
    Event publisher that executes events with timeout constraints, throwing an exception on timeout. Extends ExecuteEventPublisher to provide timeout-controlled event publishing capabilities.

    This publisher:

    • Executes events with specified timeout periods
    • Throws EventTimeoutException when events exceed their timeout
    • Uses ControlledListFuture for managing futures
    • Provides cleanup of completed and cancelled tasks

    Unlike SilentTimeoutEventPublisher, this publisher explicitly notifies about timeouts through exceptions.

    Since:
    2025-07-31
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Vladyslav Kushnir
    See Also:
    ExecuteEventPublisher, ControlledListFuture, EventTimeoutException

    • Method Detail

      • publish

        public void publish(Event<?> event,
                    long timeout,
                    TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Publishes an event with a timeout constraint. Throws an exception if the event execution exceeds the timeout.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to publish
        timeout - the maximum time to wait for event completion
        timeUnit - the time unit of the timeout
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if event is null, timeout is negative, or timeUnit is null
        IllegalStateException - if publisher is shut down
        EventTimeoutException - if event execution exceeds the timeout
        RuntimeException - if event execution fails for any other reason

      • publish

        public void publish(Event<?> event,
                    long timeout)
        Publishes an event with a timeout constraint using the default time unit.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to publish
        timeout - the maximum time to wait for event completion
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if event is null or timeout is negative
        IllegalStateException - if publisher is shut down
        EventTimeoutException - if event execution exceeds the timeout
        RuntimeException - if event execution fails for any other reason
